results.title: Free to move (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Lewis, Derek Monk, Ted Channell, Schools Council and Southern Films
results.brief_description: Attempts to show that physical education is concerned with the education of the whole child, not only his physical well being. Shows need for a broad based and varied programme of activities; and how related work in other areas of the curriculum may spring from or lead to work in movement. Presents a composite picture of the balanced programme offered in a good primary school.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Lewis, Derek Monk, Ted Channell, Schools Council and Southern Films

results.title: Free play and music
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children are encouraged to select toys or materials which interest them, each child directing his own activity with the objects. Music periods involve singing accompanied by physical participation.

results.title: Weekend Magazine: free music
results.brief_description: Explains Percy Grainger’s ideas about free music and shows the machine he had made with the help of Bernard Cross. The machine is very like a synthesizer and was meant to play Grainger’s music, which proved an impossible task for people. A Melbourne Conservatorium expert was the first person to transcribe the music on graphs on to tape, and in Bernard Cross’s presence it was played for the first time publicly.

results.title: Free fall
results.creator_credit: Arthur Lipsett, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Made of film trimmings assembled by Arthur Lipsett, this experimental film conveys a flow of intense psychological impressions representing a new form of filmed perception. Compressed into an intermittent sequence of visuals, sounds, voices and bursts of music, this film makes a wry comment on modern man and his world. It suggests a surrealist dream of mankind’s fall from grace into banality. (Awards: Montreal; San Francisco)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Lipsett, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Frederick
results.creator_credit: Giulio Gianini, Leo Lionni and Connecticut Films
results.brief_description: Based on the children’s book by Leo Lionni this film tells of four grey field mice who diligently gather food in preparation for winter, and a fifth - Frederick - who quietly sits and absorbs the joys of summer. When, in the winter, the mice have exhausted their food supply, Frederick is able to cheer his companions by recalling the visions and sensations of summer. Animated.

results.title: Freda Koblicks plastics workshop
results.brief_description: Freda Koblicks conducts plastics workshops and during these, discusses her ideas about working with plastics. These ideas concern not only techniques but also appreciation of dealing with the material.

results.title: Fred Winter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
A film portrait of Fred Winter, one of Britain’s leading steeplechase jockeys. Fred started riding at the age of four; now in his thirties, his outstanding career has seen him winner of the Grand National, twice winner of the Champion Hurdle, and four times Champion Jockey. Sequences show him in action during races, at home with his wife and children in consultation with a trainer.

results.title: The Frazers of Cabot Cove
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Paul Fletcher, Central Office of Intormation and Green Park Productions
results.brief_description: Set against the background of outpost life in Newfoundland, once Britain’s oldest colony and now Canada’s tenth province, the film tells the love-story of Mary Frazer and shows the lives and problems of the simple fishing community in which she lives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Humphrey Swingler, Paul Fletcher, Central Office of Intormation and Green Park Productions

results.title: The Franck-Hertz experiment
results.creator_credit: Jack Churchill, Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description: A stream of electrons is accelerated through mercury vapour, and it is shown that the kinetic energy of the electrons is transferred to the mercury atoms only in discreet packets of energy. The association of the quantum of energy with a line in the spectrum of mercury is established. The experiment retraced in this film was one of the earliest indications of the existence of internal energy states within the atom.

results.title: Frank Lloyd Wright Robie House
results.creator_credit: Edward Hayward, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Shows the evolution of Frank Lloyd Wright’s “prairie house” style, culminating in the Robie house in Chicago, 1908. Includes a detailed examination of the interior of the house, with the use of still shots. This film is part of a third level course series from the Faculty of Arts, open University, intended to investigate the architect and design of the period 1890-1939.
